Fields.Field: Navigate to the admin page.
Navigate to the home page.
Edit what items show up in what categories.
Create a new item.
Open an item that you created earlier.
Create a new order for one of your customers.
Open an existing order. These orders are from the web site, EDI trasfer or manual entry in this program.
Create a new account.
Open an account.
Edit menus in the system.
Modify and create scripts for sections of pages or entire pages.
See what email as gone out of the system.
Upload, download and edit files on your web server.
Get help with Rendition.
Import items, shipping services, users and more.
Change the way the items are modified when you add images to your items.
Refresh the data stored in the memory of the server from the database.
Setup Domain names, site defaults, user defaults, email control, authentication control, image template assignments, URI keys, shipping defaults and redirectors here.
Edit shipping services.
See who's visiting your site and when.
Logoff of the system.
Logon as another user.

Field.Title: Are you sure you want to delete this carrier?

Fields.Field: 'Are you sure you want to delete this service? If you want to go back click cancel. If you\'re sure you want to delete this service click Ok.

Fields.Field: Do you want to save changes you\'ve made before you close the order? If you want to return to your order and save it click cancel. If you want to close the order without saving click Ok.

Field.Title: You have recently added this item to your order, but haven\t clicked save yet.

Fields.Field: 'This order is closed and cannot be recalculated. You can only add comments or file attachments to closed orders. Other changes will not be saved.

You cannot change the quantity and cancel an item at the same time.
You cannot backorder an item and cancel an item at the same time.
You cannot decrease the number of canceled items.
You cannot decrease the number of backordered items.
This item must be confirmed before you can backorder or cancel it.

+ If you\re sure you want to leave without saving click Ok.

+ If you\re sure you want to leave without saving click Ok.

Fields.Field: Category
The name of the category.
Path to the file on the server's file system.
This a componet part to the item you are curretly editing.
This is how many of this componet part is required in this kit.
When selected, this item will appear as a seperate but related item on the invoice.

When selected, this componet part will only be added to the parent item's kit when an input on the parent item's form, named after the "Componet Type" of this componet part, is equal to this componet part's item number.
The item number.
Short description of the item.
Unique Id for each item
HTML description of the price range of a product. To be used when the price of an item can change depending on form customizations.
When the inventory level of this item reaches this level an email alert will be sent to the person specified as the operator for the item.
When checked, this item will be hidden from retail item listings.
Extended HTML description of the item. This value is displayed on the detail page of this item.
Retail price of the item.
Sale price of the item.
Wholesale price of the item.
When checked, item will use the sale price on the retail web site.
Description of the item.
Short ad copy for the item.
What category this item will link back to in item listings.
This category will be displayed below the item on the item's detail page.
How much this item weighs to ship packed.
Quantifier, for example each, set or pair.
Very small (50<) description of the item. This appears in retail and administrative lists.
When set, this item will ship for free.
Customization form this item uses.
When search results match, for example, two items in a list have the same price, which item will show up first in the list is determined by how high this number is set.
In production, this item is worth this much to produce.
When checked, this item will not be included in any tax calculations.
When checked, this item cannot be added to an order and will not show up in item listings.
When checked, this item will be marked deleted after the first time it's purchased.
When a value is present, this item will be bound to the spcified item.
Color swatch of the item.
When set, this item can be purchased even if the stock level is below 0 by accounts that have been set to allow preorders.
What production step depletes inventory for this item.
Production step that this item restocks inventory on.
What production step permanently consumes inventory for this item.
This account
Size of the item.

Setting this number will change how quantites are estimated when purchased, a higer number means that more inventory will be alloted to this item in relation to other items of the same master item. For example. A shirt comes in 1 color and 4 sizes S,M,L,XL. Setting the ratio on the S,M,L and XL items to 1,2,5,2 respectivly will fill in the "quantity to order" fields based on the this number (ratio) to 1, so the shirt in our example, a purchase order for a total of 100 units would break down to 10 S, 20 M, 50 L, 20 XL or 10:100, 20:100, 50:100, 20:100 Each item is assigned the number of shirts in relation to other items of the same master item.
What division this item belongs to.
The maximum desiered inventory level.
Unique Id for each item
Description of the item.
HTML description of the price range of a product. To be used when the price of an item can change depending on form customizations.
Quantifier, for example each, set or pair.
How much this item weighs to ship packed.
Extended HTML description of the item. This value is displayed on the detail page of this item.
Short ad copy for the item.
Very small (50<) description of the item. This appears in retail and administrative lists.
When the inventory level of this item reaches this level an email alert will be sent to the person specified as the operator for the item.
The maximum desiered inventory level.
When set, this item can be purchased even if the stock level is below 0 by accounts that have been set to allow preorders.
What production step depletes inventory for this item.
Production step that this item restocks inventory on.
What production step permanently consumes inventory for this item.

Setting this number will change how quantites are estimated when purchased, a higer number means that more inventory will be alloted to this item in relation to other items of the same master item. For example. A shirt comes in 1 color and 4 sizes S,M,L,XL. Setting the ratio on the S,M,L and XL items to 1,2,5,2 respectivly will fill in the "quantity to order" fields based on the this number (ratio) to 1, so the shirt in our example, a purchase order for a total of 100 units would break down to 10 S, 20 M, 50 L, 20 XL or 10:100, 20:100, 50:100, 20:100 Each item is assigned the number of shirts in relation to other items of the same master item.
Retail price of the item.
Sale price of the item.
Wholesale price of the item.
When checked, item will use the sale price on the retail web site.
When checked, this item will be hidden from retail item listings.
When checked, this item will not be included in any tax calculations.
When set, this item will ship for free.
What category this item will link back to in item listings.
This category will be displayed below the item on the item's detail page.
When search results match, for example, two items in a list have the same price, which item will show up first in the list is determined by how high this number is set.
Color swatch of the item.
Size of the item.
When a value is present, this item will be bound to the spcified item.
This account
What division this item belongs to.
This a componet part to the item you are curretly editing.
This is how many of this componet part is required in this kit.
When selected, this item will appear as a seperate but related item on the invoice.

When selected, this componet part will only be added to the parent item's kit when an input on the parent item's form, named after the "Componet Type" of this componet part, is equal to this componet part's item number.
Path to the file on the server's file system.
The Id of the vendors account.
What the vendor calls this item.
What the vendor describes this item as.
What you call this item.
The inner pack for this item.
The minimum this vendor requires you to order of this item.
The last price you purchased this item for.
Account number of the review.
The rating the user provided.
When selected, the message will be removed from the website listings.
The date the message was added.
The account that the price is for.
The item number the price is for.
Description of the price. For exapmle "Special prices for Acme".
Price for this account/item/date combonation
Date the price becomes valid.
Date the price is vaild until.
Name of the property. Such as height, length, manufacture, brand etc.
Value of the property. Such as 10", Acme, 14 cm..
Same as name of the property, but this value is shown to customers on the retail web site.
This determines what order these properties are displayed in when grouped in a list.
When selected, this property will try and link itself to an item to build a dynamic bill of material depening on the items customization form selections.
This can be added to the total price of the item. When linking to an item, this price will override the price of the linked item. To use the linked item's price set this value to 0.
When set, any linked items for this property will not be included in tax calculations.
When set, the linked item will appear as a seperate line on the invoice.
When set, the property will be avaliable in the 'narrow your selection' filter in the retail item listings.
The item number of this line item.
The quantity of this line item.
The price line item.
The order number of the order.
The account name of the order.
The order date of the order.
The purchase order number of the order.
The amount paid on this order.
The current status of this order.
The number of days this order is due in.
The date this order is due on.
The terms of this order.
Shipment No.
The tracking no..
Date Shipped.
The actual weight of the package shipped.
The actual service used.
The actual cost of the shipment.
The actual billed weight.
Package Length.
Package width.
Package Height.
Third party account used in this shipment.
Void status of this shipement. Status types are based on the carrier.
Date an email was sent.
Date this record was added.
The type of object this status was given to. Order, Shipment or Line.
The name of this status.
The name of the account that added this flag.
The number of the account that added this flag.
Comments added during or after the status change.
The date this order, shipment or line entered this status.
Amount of this transaction
The type of transaction. Credit card, cash, wire, etc.
Total amount of the entire transaction when multiple payments are used.
Name on the credit card when a credit card is used.
Type of credit card used. When left blank the card was autodetected based on the card number.
The number on the credit card or the last few numbers.
Experation month of the credit card.
Experation year of the credit card.
The little number on the back of hte credit card.
The user who owns the transaction.
The routing number of the wire transfer if a wire transfer was used.
The check number if a check was used.
The account number of the check or wire transfer.
The PayPal email address used if PayPal was used.
The SWIFT No. used if any.
The name of the bank if any.
The routing transit number if any.
When true this is a cash transaction.
Notes for this transaction.
The first name of the contact of this address.
The last name of the contact of this address.
Address line 1.
Address line 2.
The city of the address.
The state of the address.
The zipcode of the address.
The country of the address.
The home phone of the address.
The work phone of the address.
The email of the address.
When selected an email will be sent to the user when the status of the shipment has changed.
The selected rate.
Special instructions for this address.
Date the order was placed on.
This order's purchase order number.
The order's manifest number.
When this order should be filled.
Freight on board. The port of transit the purchase order will be delivered to.
The quantity of this line item.
The item number of this line item.
The price line item.
The production status of this line.
The date this line was added.
The order number of this line item.
The serial number of this line item.
The shipment number of this line item.
The line number of this line item.
The output status of this line item.
The output path of this line item.
The total amount added to this line from sub items in this items assembly.
The total Untaxable amount added to this line from sub items in this items assembly.
Total quantity backordered.
Total quantity Canceled.
Line number provided by the customer if any.
The account number of this account.
The name of this account.
The email address / logon for this account.
The type of account. E.g.: Customer, Employee, Vendor, etc.
Unique Id for each account.

The higher the number the more access the user has. This general access control number is set in the site configuration panel. More specific security settings can be set from the user rights assignment panel.
Name of the account. Such as Jim's Cogs
The email address of the account. This is also how the user logs into the web site.
When selected, the user will recieve wholesale item prices. User specific prices override wholesale prices.
Last time the user visited a page on this web site.
General comments about the account.
User's password.
When selected this users will have access to the back end control interface.
When selected new orders in this account will have the "Send shipment updates" checkbox checked on by default. However the user can still uncheck the checkbox.
Date the account was created on.
When exporting this account to another accounting system, what should this account be called?
Full name of the contact person for this company.
Home phone for this user.
This email address overrides the account email address for EDI transmissions.
Terms of payment. You can add and remove terms from the site configuration panel.
When selected, new orders placed in this account will not incur tax.
When selected, new orders can contain items that are out of stock. The item must also have its "allow preorders" checkbox checked.
Path to the custom packing slip PDF for this account.
Path to the custom quote PDF for this account.
Path to the custom packing slip PDF for this account.
Where this user is sent to after they logon.
This is the script that runs when this user begins their backend session.
Default service for this account when placing new orders.
Work phone for this user.
When selected, an email containing tracking information will be sent to the ship to address for orders placed on this account.
When selected, the bill to address for new orders placed on this account will be populated with the information displayed here.
How many days it takes for this user's orders to be fullfilled. For AR accounts this number is in additon to the base lead time. For AP accounts, this is the only lead time indecator.
A custom script that runs on the inital AJAX callback when the user vists or refreshes the backend program.

Depending on the EDI procedure used. Common values are "item", "customization", "general" depending on what type of data you are translating.

This allows you to replace your normal item description, copy or whatever with what your EDI customer wishes to display. For example a custom description provided by your EDI customer for an item on a packing slip to be dropshipped to your customer's customer.

Select the column you want to add to your search.
What type of match is to be made.
Match value 1.
Match value 2.
How this condition links to the condition below it.
Group these conditions into group 1-10.
The name of this division. For example, mens apparel.
Description of the swatch.
A shorter version of the swatch name. For example: Black = BLK.
Path to an image of this swatch
The size of the item as it would appear on a label.
This is the id of the flag. Flag types 0,1,5,10 are reserved. New flags can be created to track production steps.
Name of this flag.
Description of this flag.
The user security level required to commit this flag.
This flag will be avalible for shipment objects.
This flag will be avalible for user objects.
This flag will be avalible for order objects.
This flag will be avalible for order line objects.
This flag will be avalible for order line detail objects.
The text customers see as the status of the object when displayed in front end applications.
Used to determine status colors in aging reports. The higher the level the more urgency to complete status changes.
Used to determine status colors in aging reports. The higher the level the more urgency to complete status changes.
Used to determine status colors in aging reports. The higher the level the more urgency to complete status changes.
Used to determine status colors in aging reports. The higher the level the more urgency to complete status changes.
Used to determine status colors in aging reports. The higher the level the more urgency to complete status changes.
When selected, this flag will appear in production aging reports.
The order in which this flag appears in the production aging report. Lower numbers appear first.
This flag cannot occur until the object has already recieved this other flag at some point.
This flag cannot occur if the object has already recieved this other flag at some point.
This flag will be avalible for purchae order objects.
This flag will be avalible for purchae order shipment objects.
This flag will be avalible for purchae order line objects.
When an object passes through this status, a new purchase order will be chained to the order this object belongs to.
When an object passes through this status the purchase order is recieved and inventory is put in stock.
When an object passes through this status the order is canceled.
When an object passes through this status the order is closed and no further changes that effect the price of the order can be made.
The color of this flag in reports. Valid colors are .NET system color names. For example, Red, Blue, LightBlue, Green.
The name of the country.
The discount code. This is what the customer types into the discount code box.
The percent discounted.
Comments.
The starting ZIP code for this tax rate.
The ending ZIP code for this tax rate.
The tax rate for this ZIP code range.
The name of the term. For example Cash, Credit Card, Net 30 are different terms.
Is this a prepaid term: paycash/credit up front, or a accrued term: pay some time after the order is placed. If this term is accrued this value should be checked or true.
The name of the carrier.
Name of the shipping service.
When selected this service will be used in international shipments.
When selected this service can be selected.
This sets what zone a zip-to-zone lookup will return. e.g.: Class 1 returns zones 2-99, Class 2 returns zones 100-199
When selected this rate can be selected as a discounted rate. When not selected this rate's price will not be altered by shipping discounts.
Enter the carrier's tracking link for this service. The URL you enter will have the value {trackingNumber} replaced with the tracking number.
When a zip code shows up on the carrier's area surcharge table, and the user is a wholesale user, this surcharge is applied to the shipping cost.
When a zip code shows up on the carrier's area surcharge table, and the user is not a wholesale user, this surcharge is applied to the shipping cost.
The ground fuel surcharge in percent. E.g.: 2.00.
The air fuel surcharge in percent. E.g.: 2.00.
When selected this rate will appear in the retail cart.
When selected the service can be selected in public wholesale orders.
When selected this rate will appear in the order editor application.
An additional cost that is added at the end of all other calculations.
The name of the carrier.
Zip codes in this table will be subject to an additional rural area surcharge.
The package origination zip.
Begining of the zip range for this zone.
End of the zip range for this zone.
Shipping zone for this zip range.
Name of the shipping service.
This sets what zone a zip-to-zone lookup will return. e.g.: Class 1 returns zones 2-99, Class 2 returns zones 100-199
When selected this rate can be selected as a discounted rate. When not selected this rate's price will not be altered by shipping discounts.
When selected this service can be selected.
When selected this service will be used in international shipments.
When a zip code shows up on the carrier's area surcharge table, and the user is a wholesale user, this surcharge is applied to the shipping cost.
When a zip code shows up on the carrier's area surcharge table, and the user is not a wholesale user, this surcharge is applied to the shipping cost.
The ground fuel surcharge in percent. E.g.: 2.00.
The air fuel surcharge in percent. E.g.: 2.00.
An additional cost that is added at the end of all other calculations.
When selected this rate will appear in the retail cart.
